result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa R Fawley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lisa R Fawley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lisa R Fawley was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lisa R Fawley

records.addlTxt: Revoked-sentenced to Co Jail

Defendant Lisa R Fawley in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Defendant Lisa R Fawley in custody.  Lester H Liptak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Revocation packet has been reviewed by parties, no additions or corrections to the Rev packet.  Argument entered by both parties.  DE has credit for 75 days.  State recommends 100 days jail.  Court will accept the recommendations of the State.  Court will order 100 days jail, credit for time served.  JU for unpaid court obligations.  Sentence is for time already served.

Defendant Lisa R Fawley in court with attorney Bryce Alan Schoenborn.  James D Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement has been reached in this matter.  State recites agreement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE will enter a plea of NC, court will accept and find the DE guilty.  Court will accept the recommendations of the parties.  Will order sentence withheld, CC, DNA sample

Call from DE this day that her vehicle is going into the shop for repairs tomorrow and she will have no transportation to get here for her sentencing hearing.  Informed DE to call her attorney.   DE also concerned about warrant for CS that has been filed on her, informed DE to contact child support on this issue.
Plea hearing on February 28, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
